pros: SH has great leadership in Jonathan Lee. He is a CEO who really cares and tries to make things the best he can for his employees.
cons: It’s community mental health, which is hard work.

job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Cleveland, OH
pros: One of the Higher pay I’ve seen in these types of mental health agencies.
cons:
Overworked AND Underappreciated workers definitely!

Higher pay seems to compensate for the highway robbery of your time off from work because Any paid time off is all from one bank of time. Meaning there is no holiday pay at all. There is no separate sick time, personal time, or vacation time pay that you accrue. You have only one very small amount of any kind of PAID TIME OFF that you accrue per pay. You must give your earned PTO for holidays when the agency is closed! You don’t even get a paid lunch. Lunch is 30 minutes and You have to punch in and punch out IF you want to take lunch.

And you will need lunch as it can be your only breathing time due to having a jam packed schedule of patients from the moment you start until the end of the day. They make you produce schedules full of clients that would be unrealistic and overwhelming to see them all in a day. Your only saving grace is in patient cancellations or no shows so that you can breathe or use the restroom. If all patients show it’s overwhelming and seeing that many patients per day per week is guaranteed burnout for yourself as a provider of mental health care. 

It’s your Typical mental health agency offering no care or concern for the mental health caregiver. There’s no incentives, rewards, or encouragement being given along the way to recognize praise or acknowledge the hard and challenging work inherent to counseling/mental health work. And, the only feedback given is in hearing about a job done or gone wrong.Nothing is being said about the good or what’s going right.

pros: Pay, benefits cost, time off
cons: Workload, disorganized, inconsistent, not a lot of support

job_title: Ryan White Medical Case Manager in Painesville, OH
pros: Majority of the people working at the agency are very passionate and wonderful to work with.
cons: High turnover rate and upper management does not look well upon those who speak up or question practices. No parental leave. Low pay and the benefits are abysmal. Difficult to move up.

job_title: Mental Health Counselor in Willoughby, OH
pros: Great coworkers and ground support. Great compensation
cons: Difficult populations, recent corporate change causing some internal communication issues.

job_title: QMHS Case Manager in Willoughby, OH
pros: Flexible schedule, vacation, pto, and the most important the clients. I was able to meet some amazing people that taught me just as much as I taught them. It is the reason I went into the field.
cons: Expectations are ridiculous, billable hours are the ONLY benchmark for performance, reviews were done late or not at all, never praised only told what I was doing wrong, the senior management has been there for years and sucks all the budget for salaries leaving everyone else with nothing. There were case managers who were on food stamps. I brought it to the attention of the CEO and he blew me off. They designed a "position change" where we would make more money, yay, only to do way more work, with way more expectations, and way more opportunities for them to discipline us. Case workers, if I am guessing, make a lot of money for the company and get treated like garbage. They do not get paid a living wage and the CEO claims to want to help people. How about they help their employees first?

cons: Things get busy. Must be able to do many things at a time.

pros: Friendly environment. Great opportunities for growth. Great opportunities for training. Supervisors and upper administration are open to suggestions and easy to reach. Agency really values good client care.
cons: Can feel very separated from other departments/ locations.

review_title: A company that sets itself apart from everyone else.
pros: Having worked in the behavioral health field with other employers and being a Signature employee for quite some time, I can tell you without a shadow of a doubt that Signature Health is one of the best places to work.  Everyone is kind, helpful, and make you feel welcome.  Many employee have left and came back over the years due to it being such a great place to work.  New ideas are welcomed, management has an open door policy, and advancement is not only discussed but encouraged.  Personally, I will continue to work at Signature Health as long as they'll have me.
cons: None that I can think of

pros: Flexible schedule, possibility for bonuses, supportive co workers
cons: Productivity standards put pressure on employees to make the company money rather than focus on high quality of care. Many of the supervisors played favorites, and some CPST's would blame you for their mistakes before they would take responsibility. A lot of competition between CPST's to lead groups, as it increases productivity. Too many clients assigned to one CPST. Also, the company "does not give raises" to their employees. Except the supervisors and higher up people. They get raises.

pros: The salary plus bonus is nice, many nice coworkers, benefits are great and they offer domestic partnership benefits.
cons: Patients are not the top priority but rather payment is.  On multiple occasions, I was told to bill  more time than was actually spent with the patient to get more reimbursement.  Once you use any of the benefits such as FMLA or STD, they put a mark on your back and try anything to get you fired.

pros: CEO seems invested in growing the company.  Good PTO.  Decent pay.
cons: You’ll have to sell your soul to make this job work. Site management does not care about the wellbeing or stress of their employees but works very hard to make themselves look good to executives. The workload for decent patient care is unrealistic and the bottom line is that this company prides itself on quantity, NOT quality of care causing its staff and ultimately the patients to suffer. High turnover with very low support from the top.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in Garfield Heights, Cuyahoga, OH
pros: I will start off as the co-workers are the best part of the job. And thats pretty much it.  Oh yeah, and Pharmaceutical lunches.
cons: It's starts at $12 hr and ends at $12 hr. No raises! And crappy bonuses! They don't appericate their schedulers because thats what you are. Great for someone who is just out of college and/or some who needs office experiences. However, that is a disservice to your co-workers because this job is high traffic.
